Reviews.Title: “Bed factory or remand home”
Reviews.Author: buongustaio
Reviews.Content: Some Travelodges are OK, I've used them on odd occasions off the motorways: cheap, no frills, no service but clean and tidy. This one is not. The whole bathroom was a mess, peeling, tiles and fittings falling off. It's a depressing place, very tired and sad and in dire need of a refit. One nice girl on reception who deserves a job at a better hotel, one off-hand receptionist. Can be problem getting in from the car park if the receptionist isn't present - and they are not always! There are better deals than this place offers!

Reviews.Title: “May not be your first choice but it should be considered”
Reviews.Author: Kaygee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in february 2012, and as my title suggests it was not my first choice, but it was so close to where I needed to be that I couldn't really consider going anywhere else. I paid less that £60 per night, and you may be thinking, Travelodge... that cheap in london - where is the catch? Well being honest there isn't one. It has all that you need from a cheap place to stay. It has a car park, for £5 for 24hrs - good price. There are 4 floors of rooms, and it has lifts, so no worries there. The foyer is simple, it has a choice of vending machines, as the hotel doesn't offer a restaurant (but there is a lovely Italian a few doors away). Reception was fine, and the hotel manager was lovely. She was very friendly and always asked if I needed anything extra, like tea or coffee. The rooms were standard Travelodge type, you know, a bed, open wardrobe, desk, tea/coffee/kettle, TV. The bathroom was fine, functional enough and well lit. One thing that I must comment on is cleanliness - as a woman who travels all over the place, I know what an awful hotel can be like - and this place was spotless. I was really impressed. No dust, no cobwebs, clean carpets, clean bathroom and it smelled clean too. If there was a negative it would be breakfast in a box, but hey - it isn't the Ritz! Would I recommend a friend to stay - yes, certainly, as long as they knew that it was a no frills, cheap hotel, that was an ideal base, but it was clean and friendly... I know that I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money. Excellent Hotel As A Base”
Reviews.Author: stinkyparp
Reviews.Content: Had read quite a few indifferent reviews about this hotel, so was a little concerned about our stay. However apon arrival i have to say i was impressed with the size of room, cleanliness and location of the hotel (20 mins to west end) We only used the hotel as a base for a couple of nights and for that it was fantastic and great value (booked in advance). I'd agree with another review on this site and say use the wetherspoons pub (The Asparagus) down the road for breakfast. Only negative comment for me was the bed was a little soft. .

Reviews.Title: “TOP VALUE FOR LONDON - 82%”
Reviews.Author: HoneyMonsterontour
Reviews.Content: Paid a stonking £44-50 for 2 nights room only. Usual Travelodge room - good size , great comfy bed and clean. All lights in room working unlike many other hotels (I don't mean Travelodge). Staff are friendly - a nice change for London. Not the nicest of areas but bus 44 goes right past direct from Victoria. Recommend you give the b/fast a miss ( a rather uninteresting orange juice,muffin,corn flakes and croissant) @ £4-50 and walk down the road to the nearest Weatherspoon, Get the full monty for an extra 50 P !!.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Position, no problems.”
Reviews.Author: GKWSomerset
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the hotel. The receptionist was very friendly, we had a ground floor room which was very spacious. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small but adequate. The T.V. only had one good channel and that was the news channel, but we were not bothered about watching it anyway. The receptionist told us that we could order a takeaway from a local restuarant and they would deliver it to our room. Brilliant! After a tiring day, we did not want to go out again, and the meal arrived after 30 minutes and was very good. We recommend the Italian restaurant which is almost next door to the hotel. The number 44 bus from Victoria stops right outside, ideal if you are not driving. We would stay again, ideal for a night in "almost" central London.

Reviews.Title: “spacious room with fairly easy access to westend”
Reviews.Author: kargyle
Reviews.Content: little bit worried after some reviews - however had a really nice stay. Arrived early and receptionist very helpful and checked us in so we could go into town Â£5 parking for 24 hrs. Arrived back at 11.30pm after show - little bit apprensive about room but had a spacious room which looks like it has recently been tidied up. Room basic but clean. Good nights sleep. Stayed in room 409. Not the greatest of areas but only paid Â£15. Thank you travel lodge for a good night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, not the best area...”
Reviews.Author: danijohnson12
Reviews.Content: The hotel was actually very nice, after walking there I was very nervous, never seen so many police cars! There were some noisy people in the hotel but you'd get that anywhere. It had a very spacious room. I'd reccoment the hotel but not the area :) And for Â£29 on a Friday in London you can't complain!!

Reviews.Title: “clean comfortable with easy access to the westend”
Reviews.Author: chynagirl1
Reviews.Content: Battersea Travelodge we stayed here for two nights starting 8th February. The Travelodge was easy to spot driving in to Battersea and the car par is situated behind the building, but get there quick as there are not many spaces. The car park cost Â£5 for 24hrs you pay at the machine or you can ring the phone number and pay by card. We were allocated room 419 which is the last room on the top floor, the room was very clean, fixtures were slightly worn but they did the job. The room looks directly down on to the car park at first we did not like that it was so far to walk from reception but in the end we were glad it was. As it was the last room in the corridor we had no noisy drunks going past, no kids running up and down the corridors so in all we had two nights of peacefully sleep. The hotel is a short bus ride from Victoria tube station and you can catch the bus no 44 from just outside the hotel. Just next to hotel is an Italian restaurant and there is some take always and a small shop. Further down the road about 3 stops on the no44 bus or 5 mins in the car there is a wetherspoons pub which serves typical pub food, food was of a good standard we had an evening meal and a full English breakfast. While we stayed in the hotel we did see some unsavoury typeâ€™s one guy on his mobile swearing down the phone at the top of his voice and he stood there doing this in just his underpants standing next to the lift. The hotel was used a lot by workmen while we stayed there but we did see some families as well. Would I stay here again yes I would and I would ask for room 419 because the most important thing for me is not about the fixtures and fitting but is it clean and do I get a good nightâ€™s sleep especially as I had a 7 hour drive home.

Reviews.Title: “avoid, unless you get a very, very good deal”
Reviews.Author: ryeats
Reviews.Content: I would like to echo everything said in the one star reviews: like all Travelodges this is dirty, noisy, seedy and generally depressing. You should avoid unless you get a great deal. (If you pay more than Â£30 for a double it's a rip off) The only good thing to be said about it is the free car park, though it is often filled by white vans, for the teams of labourers who stay in the 'hotel.'

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Helen R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Travelodge in January 2012. I almost didn't book based on some bad reviews I had read on this site but it was much more reasonably priced than the nearby Holiday Inn, so I decided to chance it. I stayed for 2 nights for around Â£60 which for the area was outstanding (the second night was part of their seasonal sale). The Hotel itself is basic with no restaurant or bar area, but who really goes to a travelodge to hang out in the hotel bar? The surrounding area has a lot of great restaurants /shops/ bars to chose from so hanging out in the hotel was never part of my plan. The room was basic was very clean and comfortable. The only downside to the room was the lack of mirror. The bathroom was clean and had fresh towels ans the water pressure in the shower was lovely. The room has a small TV but the channels were limiting (we couldnt seem to find BBC1 and the channels were jumbled up) A 15 minute walk to Clapham junction rail, or a 3 minute bus ride, or a Â£5 taxi trip. A great location, great price, basic but what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Easily the nicest Travelodge I have stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: dgrbleu2
Reviews.Content: Will certainly stay here again! By far the nicest Travelodge I have stayed in. Comfy bed, very clean, walk-in type shower. Felt newer and less run down than the same brand hotel I stayed at two weeks back. Taxi from Clapham Junction costs a fiver, otherwise use bus C3 or 295 to Hope Street, drops you less than a minute away. Have their own carpark but suggest you arrive early if you plan to use it as there are not too many spaces. Cheap, though, at five per night. Room was 40 or so on advance purchase. Already planning to use this location again for the same event in 2013. (Sorry I forgot my camera on this trip, I would have liked to have shown you all just how nice this location was, especially in relation to other locations of the same brand!)

Reviews.Title: “Good by Travelodge Standards”
Reviews.Author: UKMH
Reviews.Content: My room was clean, tidy and relatively spacious. I had an 8ft long desk by the window and an uncomfortable chair to go with it. I wouldn't recommend for more than one person in a room as it is very very basic. Good value for Â£30ish if you book in advance but not if you book at last minute and pay Â£90. Location is in the middle of nowhere, no easy access to tube network.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ABSWLondon
Reviews.Content: Perfectly good standard of Travelodge. Nicer than the outside suggests as it's on a main road - thought room would be really noisy but it isn't excessively so. Got an advance cheap deal - room nice and big, very clean. Polite and very helpful staff. Does the job well!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and damp”
Reviews.Author: Doot81
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay at this Travelodge as, in our experience, they have always provided value for money offering well-sized, clean rooms at decent prices. On arrival there was an overpowering smell of cleaning products but in our room all we could smell was a damp, mildew smell. As we were already late for where we needed to be we didn't bother asking for a change of room as we figured we would only be spending the hours of sleep in the room. I didn't sleep too well as bed was very soft and sagged into the middle. On waking, the smell was still overpowering so we left as soon as we could. The shower was ok, the TV worked, the staff were polite, and the location was quiet enough and good for our needs. However, I would not stay here again and would not recommend staying here to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: yadayaba
Reviews.Content: Good size room, Clean hotel. For a one night stay at a travel lodge what more can you ask. The only downside was the tv picture reception was quite poor and i had to fix it and when i paid cash for the room. they didnt have enougth change so I lost out on getting back my 5p on checking out manager ask me who i would rate the stay on travel lodge.com and then asked me to bump up my reveiw as an 8 isnt good enougth according to travellodge. All in all not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Was a very disappointing stay...”
Reviews.Author: stevejanklm
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the travel lodge not knowing what to expect.. We walked up to the rooms , the rooms weren't very clean at all! The first one had a stain all over the wall, in all of the rooms the beds and sheet were all stained and not very comforting to sleep in at all! Then in one of the other rooms as we pulled out the roll out bed, it had a cigarette lighter in the bed...!!!! then when exciting the lift there was a dog barking at you and other people staying there had birds staying there, a bit too animal friendly...k

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Myair
Reviews.Content: My friend and I(both female pensioners) stayed for one night December 11th rooms were clean and tidy.Plenty of coffee and tea good kettle.Bath was clean as was beds. Checking in was pleasant good rooms 301and 308. had a problem with 308 could not get in went back to reception different person not helpful at all luckily original person arrived soon sorted. The hotel is on York road the no 44 bus runs every few minuites into Victoria the stop is about 100 yards from the hotel both ways. There is also a night bus service. Considering the area is busy there is not a lot of noise double glazing is excellent.Would have no problems in staying there again. The whole area calms down at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good-location could be better”
Reviews.Author: Cat065
Reviews.Content: we stayed for one night in december. the hotel itself is fine- the staff were friendly and efficient, the room spacious, clean, bed comfortable, tea & coffee making facilities. Water in the shower was luke -warm at times. the real issue was the location of the hotel & we could not work out why travelodge had situated their hotel in this area- it is a 20 minute walk from clapham junction railway station and situated opposite a large council estate which some might feel intimidating. If you do stay here, we would recommend that you get a cab back to the hotel at night rather than walk. OK for the intrepid urban traveller, but would not recommend for single females or families.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in London”
Reviews.Author: keithandsuesmith
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night after a night in London. On arrival the receptionist was very polite and helpful. The room was basic, clean and comfortable with everything you need for a short stay. The car park is a pay and display but you get a cheaper rate of Â£5 for 24 hours if you are a guest. No food available in the Hotel but there are some pubs and restaurants nearby. I probably wouldn't want to stay here for a long stay but for the cost it's fine for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “New Broom???”
Reviews.Author: meadowview69
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Travelodge many times but we felt there had been a pleasant change at this hotel immediately we walked in the front door. The staff have always been friendly but the blue carpet previously showed bits of dirt etc. There were improvements on this occasion and our room also had a fresher feel about it with clean sheets & towels. Maintenance was also good with everything working correctly in the room, a good improvement from previous stays. Other reviews comment on this lodge being too far from the West End etc but the 44 bus to Victoria frequently stops outside the hotel & if you take a 5minutes walk towards Battersea Bridge & turn left into Lombard Road you can catch another bus to Victoria via Chelsea. It takes about 20 minutes to get into Victoria depending on the traffic. We never eat in the lodge itself usually eating in the West End but if you turn left after leaving the front door & left again before you reach Homebase you will be 2 minutes away from the river. Turn left again at the river & after a 5minutes riverside walk you will arrive at the Waterfront restaurant/pub. Not eaten here(normally drink) but menu looks good & it is always busy at weekends & sunny evenings because you can watch all the water traffic from the table/chairs outside. Turn right at the river & walk towards Battersea Bridge past The Fish Place restaurant (not tried), past the Heliport & after a very interesting 15minutes riverside stroll you get to Battersea Bridge where many more buses can be caught going into the centre. Another reason we stay at this lodge is because the car parking cost Â£5.00 for 24hrs & we will definitely use again if the hotel standards continue to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Quite basic, but spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: djc111
Reviews.Content: I was slightly cautious about booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but decided every hotel is bound to have 'some' bad reviews! Reception staff were very helpful and friendly and even dealt with booking a taxi for us for early the next morning rather than just giving us the number of a company. The room was farily basic, but spotlessly clean and had pretty much everything needed - desk, chair, wardrobe, full length mirror, tea and coffee and very effective, adjustable heating. Things like hairdryers could be borrowed from reception. Room was quite spacious, although bathroom was pretty pokey and shower was one of those 'eco showers' and had very little power or flow. View was nothing to write home about (building works behind the hotel) but we didn't book a travelodge expecting stunning views! It was perfectly located just a short taxi ride from Chelsea where we needed to be. Despite being on a main road, there was no noise at all, thanks to very good double glazing. Not the sort of place to book if you want a luxorious weekend away, but really decent value if you just need somewhere clean and quiet as a base and to sleep. Would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “cheap & cheerful option if central location not important”
Reviews.Author: carltonmike
Reviews.Content: very helpful and pleasant staff ; clean and relatively quiet despite being on busy road . Let down by distance from tube stations, but frequent ( every 10-15 mins ) buses at 100 yds from hotel - number 44 to Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “sept 2011 battersea”
Reviews.Author: randn94
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was excellent- she explained that the room allocated was maybe going to be a bit noisy as it was at the front upstairs. So she decided to allocate me to a ground floor room which was really quiet. Thank you! However, the room was a bit depressing !. It didnt smell very fresh and I did wonder how clean the carpets were. I got the measure of the room when i realised there was no wastepaper bin but there was a bear bottle opener mounted onto the units !! mmm class! No shower gel or shampoo and the floor in the bathroom looked like it was giving up the ghost!. I was told that breakfast would be delivered to my room which I looked forward to until it arrived !! It was a plastic bag with everything in sealed containers . Still the bag was useful as it became a wastepaper bin for me . Hopefully , i wont have to stay there again unless my employer books it by mistake.

Reviews.Title: “it is clean and spacious but its like staying in a horror movie”
Reviews.Author: Yanko S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this terrible hotel for 14nights coz my manager made a mistake and booked this due to the short notice. In any other case, where I would paying for myself, i would rather share a room in any hostel or just sleep on the street! No closets, disgusting smell in the room, only 2 towels, no shampoo or shower gel,no mini bar, no food in the hotel, no security, dirty floors, monotonic, broken lights, strange dudes.....

Reviews.Title: “satisfied”
Reviews.Author: gary g
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Battersea Travelodge on September 24th. Our room was a family room on the fourth floor. We found it to be clean, very quiet and adequate for our stay in London. We also found the reception staff to be polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly, the worst hotel in the world. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: Goonergirl62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once about 8 months ago for a weekend. I was visiting family nearby. Firstly, as a long female traveller, I felt very intimidated by the lobby. The night porter was on duty and he had all his mates sat in the back watching the television. He also seemed unable to string a sentence together. They were there every night of my short stay. The room initially seemed OK; it was spacious but closer inspection revealed peeling wall and floor linings, an air of unkemptness around the furniture, cigarette burns everywhere, dirty window cills, etc. The linen was of the cheapest quality and although I felt it was clean,it was not pleasant to use. There was a bit of argy-bargy about getting hold of a hairdryer - I had booked one prior to arrival but it was not available when I got there but it got sorted out eventually. The lady who looked in charge the next morning seemed to be more with it and had the right attitude. Hopefully she has moved to a better place now. Only stay here if you are absolutely, totally desperate. I don't mind cheap; that I understand. What I don't understand is how they get away with this kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bog - no hope if the basics aren't right!!”
Reviews.Author: Scullduggery
Reviews.Content: We went to stay in this 'hotel' for a weekend family thing taking place in Piccadilly Circus. We'd been looking for a hotel the wk before and this one appeared to be so much cheaper (Â£74.00) and only 6 miles to central London so we thought it was an ideal choice with realistic expectations this was going to be no Savoy! (although only decent transport it transpired was taxi and cost Â£23 there and Â£19 back). I expected a budget hotel due to the price we paid, but seriously, even the basics weren't right. We paid Â£5 to stay in the carpark which was handy. The receptionist was warm and friendly on arrival and asked for feedback as this hotel had been newly taken over (not sure how that works with travelodge chains?). We booked in fine and stayed in room 214. I am a buildings project manager by trade, so always look at things in a bit more detail. The room had been recently decorated and furniture seemed new. Bed sheets were clean and crisp and matress looked brand new with no staining. The works that had taken place in the room i.e sockets, general updating had been done poorly, shodily and of low standard. Although the bathroom had some new vinyl anti-slip flooring, the rest of it was pretty vile - dank shower curtain (1980s), nasty germy tiles that needed ripping out (1970s), shower over bath covered in limescale, old metal bin that didn't open in a wet environment spells rust, artex ceiling above falling away with debris hanging on by it's finger nails. Not pleasant to look at. Shower extractor not working and therefore causing the room to be constantly wet and smelly. Bonus was that our shower thermostat worked fine and there was ample hot water in the evening and again in the morning. We only had one towel between us so we had to ask for another, and there was a little towel and unsure if this was a bath mat or hand towel? We went for bath mat option, as assumed the bathroom floor must not be particuarly clean either. I also did not fancy walking round the room barefoot for reasons below. The WORST issues were the cleanliness of the room: THE BOG....IT WAS VILE. Why cleaners aren't taught the basics to clean under the rim of bogs is unbelievable. Clearly visible just looking at it, under the toilet rim, was loads and loads of crusty, brown [--], probably years of excrement moulded on and left to fester. Seriously nasty and big germ alert. Under and around the bed, were lots of thick, curly, pubic hairs. Again, horific. Can't their cleaners get a decent hoover and give that carpet a good going over? Only visible in dim light, there was a large stain on the wall by the bed, god knows what THAT was. Inside the interior of the hotel, it looks worn and shabby. It needs a good redecoration and deep clean. Simple things like emergency exit signs, door numbers all need replacing and look knackered. The outside exterior reflects the interior and could do with a facelift. We did not have a good night's sleep. Although the room was at the back of the hotel so we got no road noise, we got noise from the hotel's carpark, with guests leaving at all hours and tooting horns etc. Plus other guests coming back late and being noisy, although that's not the hotel's fault. We did not hear any planes either. Leaving in the morning was a god send and we had a local Mackers breakfast instead of the hotel's 'package'. (For your info, the local Mackers is at the large roundabout - turn right as you leave the hotel and you can see it on the corner there, get in left hand lane). Not great but better option than their ripoff offering. There was a strange smell of frying fish blasting out of nearby extractors in the hotel carpark, which made me feel sick, especially with a big hangover. Overall, and reading other comments here - it seems a bit like a lottery as to whether you get a bad/poor room or a terrible/vile one. One thing i would bring with you if you must stay here is the bleach and a cloth! oh and a hoover - Enjoy the pubes!

Reviews.Title: “APPALLING”
Reviews.Author: Winco47
Reviews.Content: This is a copy of my complaint to Travelodge. I think it says it all! "My wife and I stayed for two nights at the London Battersea Travelodge on the 3rd and 4th September. We were allocated the twin room, as we had requested on booking back in July, room 301. On arrival at the hotel the receptionist wanted us to take a double room. She said that room 301was a family room, the hotel was full and we were only one couple. It was a little embarrassing to have to explain at the desk with others around that my wife and I like to sleep in separate beds, which is why we had booked a twin room i.e. a room with two beds. Is this not the usual reason why one asks for a twin-bedded room? Anyway we went up to 301 and dropped off our bags before going straight out for a scheduled meeting with relations, not returning until later that night to sleep. It was only the next morning that we saw properly the terrible state of our room. The previous night we had already noticed that the sofa bed was in a very poor state. It had not been made up properly when we got into the room. When we did make it up on our return, we saw that the mattress had no cover and was dirty and stained. The mattress itself was very thin, hard and uncomfortable and the pillows also were exceedingly thin and hard. The bolster cover was also torn, stained and dirty. In the morning we saw that the whole room was scruffy and dirty. The one and only chair in the room was filthy with torn upholstery and protruding stuffing. The room carpet was stained and had clearly not seen a vacuum cleaner that works efficiently in a long time. There were brown stains on the ceiling above the dressing table, probably beer stains because of the handy bottle opener screwed to the side of the dressing table. The room had only open shelves with a bent hanging rail and several missing hangars. We felt that we had woken up in a back-packers 'doss house'. The bathroom was just as bad. The small waste bin had a broken lid which lay along side on the floor. It was disgustingly stained and dirty. The shower thermostat did not work and after two minutes of warm water the temperature rapidly fell to stone cold. No amount of increasing the temperature would make it go hot. Forced to use the small bath I found it like trying to bathe in a shoe box (I am six foot two plus). There was no bath mat, unless the one single towel supplied was for this use? The bath tap mixer unit was missing its two indicator buttons so exposing the inside. Not only unhygienic but showing that there had been problems in the past. We had endured a night of very little sleep the first night due to the incredible noise, inside and outside. I am sure you must be fully aware of the traffic noise from York Road. This noise continued unabated throughout the Saturday night and was then accompanied by the first aircraft arrivals into Heathrow at 06:00. Being a warm period we had to get some air into the room, so we had to have the windows open otherwise we would have roasted. Although even with the windows open, it was terribly stuffy and warm. The following night the noise still kept us awake but this time there was additional noise at 04.00 from the arrival of guests in the next room and their friends further down the corridor. I realise however that you cannot be held responsible for other guest's noise, although some warning of the traffic noise would have been helpful. Now that we know about this, we definitely won't be staying here again. Why were we not warned? All in all this room was a disgrace and without doubt, this was the worst budget hotel that we have ever stayed in. It makes Premier Inns look 5 star! It was not as if I had paid Â£19 a night for this room, which in my opinion was the most it was worth. I paid Â£131.80 for this dreadful experience. Room 301 falls far below the standard that any reasonable person would expect from a budget hotel. I feel that you have taken my money under false pretences and I require compensation.. On checking out I was surprised to be asked if everything had been alright! I asked the receptionist if she really did want to know. So when she said abruptly â€œthat's why I askedâ€� I told her. As it happened the maintenance man was passing the desk and on being told of the shower problem he really did not seem to be too surprised. The receptionist then said, â€œwe do have better roomsâ€�! I asked why then we were not given one as we had booked so far in advance? This was met with a blank look. At this point I felt it was better for us to leave. I look forward to your response". The eventual response from Travelodge did not address my complaints at all! In fact it makes me wonder if anyone actually did read it. It just makes me feel that they hope that eventually you will give up and go away. Well I have and never will I stay at this or any other Travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, fair location”
Reviews.Author: FunnyAnimal
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget choice, although it is a bit of a journey to get to the center of London. It is a long walk from the train and tube station. There aren't too many close-by pubs or restaurants, although it is close to the Thames. The rooms are newer than many other places in London and well-maintained. No restaurant or bar here, but a continental breakfast can be delivered to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: louandtone
Reviews.Content: Not the best travellodge I ve stayed in. But ok for a crashpad. Don't order the breakfast pack..they aren't that nice and not worth the money. Buses run right outside, so accessible for clapham, battersea and Victoria. Not cheap either but it served a purpose. The shower was either freezing or boiling, the thermostat tap was broken.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Maccers54
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Not the best Travelodge we have stayed in - the rooms were tired and painted battleship grey. Linen and furniture have seen better days - the towels were grey too. One big plus is the car park - Â£5 for 24 hours. Good location - 10 minutes walk to Clapham Junction - but you probably want to take a taxi at night Â£5. Local bars and restaurants there inc. Pizza Express, Chinese and Indians plus Slug and Lettuce and a good Nicholson's boozer. Noisy with the windows open We paid Â£35 a night so can't grumble but would't pay full price!

Reviews.Title: “There's budget then there's this”
Reviews.Author: Kate G
Reviews.Content: Broken stairs, broken windows, broken bed, dodgy stains. I'm a happy camper and have no airs and graces about where i lay my head for the night but i've experienced before in a New York hostel dormitory room than this hotel. Put me off Travelodge for a long time & they will never be my first choice. Location ok, parking is a squeeze, as its first come first served you could have the joy of having to find road parking and the rooms were awful.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but good value, and we will use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Wendys300761
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back home after a very enjoyable family 5 night stay in london. I have to say after reading some of the feedback on this hotel l was worried, but need not have been, the staff were friendly, the room was clean and large. yes it is a bit tired and could do with a spruce up, but it is just a base and very cheap for london. The 44 bus outside the hotel has you at Victoria station in 15/20mins or cross the road and the C3 takes you to Earls court and underground in 15mins. A reasonable pizza takeaway is just a few doors down, and Batterse Park is a great place to visit with the Kids when you want to take time off from the madness of the city ( Get of the 44 bus at Tesco, grab a picnic, plenty of tables at the play and adventure park which is monitored by play leaders free of charge ) I would stay at this hotel again and recomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the customer service”
Reviews.Author: Valerie480
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister in July. I agree it is a bit shabby looking, but apart from a stained cover on the sofabed, the room and bathroom were clean and spacious. No air con, but the window opened and it wasn't noisy for London. Best bit was the customer service on arriving and leaving. Two sets of very helpful receptionists, organising taxis for us etc. Breakfast was delivered on time and there was a nice tv and tea/coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: CMMScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge in Battersea for my Brothers wedding on the 2nd July. The room was too hot, as there was no air-conditioning. When we opened the window, the inch allowed by the safety catch, we had the soothing sounds of Heathrow airport to help us drift us off to sleep. There was no plug in the bath, the towels were dirty and smelt and the mould was taking over the tiles on the walls. We had requested a travel cot for my daughter, I even called twice from Edinburgh to make sure there was one, however, suprise suprise, there were no cots available. As a family, we have stayed in many a travelodge and all have been of a certain standard, but this one. NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeWri
Reviews.Content: Arrived on foot in a depressing part of town after a long, long train journey - do not be taken in by the deceptive Underground map - it is miles away!!! On arrival, the lobby area should have told us all we needed to know - dark, shabby and in desperate need of updating. This was the highlight of the building. The room was worse - grubby and worn out. My daughter (12) was desperate for the bathroom but came straight out - "someone's already used it" She went back in and flushed - "its OK dad - thats just the colour of the water". To be fair to the guy on reception he was suitably embarrased about the whole situation and recommended some other Travelodges that were (in his words) "of a much better standard." !! We were able to get a full refund and booked in elsewhere - the Â£40 taxi fare was the best money I have ever spent. Only stay here if you have to - and even then give it some serious tought.

Reviews.Title: “good for type budget hotel. But not perfect”
Reviews.Author: pdhmjh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two night 2 people. Used public transport only. Car park nearby but you might have to pay according to room available. Vending machine in lobby for a few extras drinks ,food packs etc. The hotel is on a bus route that is very good, about 30 minutes to get to Victoria. Do not try to use underground as not direct station nearby. Yes the hotel is tired, but the room was clean and tidy. You have to expect to pay more for London. Breakfast was extra supplied in small pack at 6.30 am. Worked well for our needs. Staff was friendly but not helpful when you have only 3 pillows for two people asked for extra one, so we could have a more pleasant sleep but told pillows not available! So had to use extra clothing to prop up head. Note we have stayed at other Travelodgeâ€™s in the UK, they do vary in size of room in some cases we have had a very large room for just Â£19.00. but style of rooms are all similar. As far as other guests making noise, yes if you are in a city sometimes you have to put up with some banging doors or a few shouts now and then.

Reviews.Title: “Clean functional and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mariaharryman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here overnight to enjoy a couple of days in london. I was a bit worried when I read the reviews here but I felt I had to write as I don't think the poor reviews do the hotel justice. The staff were friendly and the room was spacious clean and functional, if your driving there is a large carpark at a very reasonable daily charge what more does one want or expect? The train station is a short walk away taking u straight into waterloo and the Southbank area perfect for the Tate Museums or London Eye. I couldn't fault the hotel and would definately use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes.”
Reviews.Author: twingo2
Reviews.Content: Arrived just after 2pm. Parked up forÂ£5.00 for 24hrs in the hotel car park. It's not a pretty hotel but its in Battersea, not the Lake District. If you want to look and pick fault you can, but at Â£39.50 for two for a London hotel, I think it was a bargain. You've got Focus next door for any DIY emergancy and a burger trailer! The hotel is on the 295 bus route which runs 24hrs a day up to Hammersmith. Takes about 30 mins so if you are going to the Apollo, its ideal. The fare is Â£2.20 each way. Bargain. Forget the Â£4.50 breakfast in a bag - why would you even consider it... walk out the front doors of the hotel, go right up the round and you have the "York Cafe". Fantastic cafe breakfast for two people costing Â£10. Of course if thats too much, Maccy D's is a little further up the road at the roundabout. The windows barely open and the room was a bit stuffy for lack of air but that could be the same for any hotel. I would book again for a similar visit etc but just on price and loaction, not because I love Travelodges!

Reviews.Title: “Hovel”
Reviews.Author: Buster2004
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what was happening in London on this particular evening, but all our usual company hotels were unavailable, and what was available on hotels.com and laterooms.com was in excess of Â£400 for the night, so I ended up here. I was not too concerned in advance, I'm no snob and have stayed in my fair share of Travelodge type places before and usually found them to be more than adequate for a bed for the night. This isn't. After a Â£28 cab ride to get there from our central London office, I arrived at the shabbiest building in an area of shabby buildings. The "From Â£29 a night" advert outside was rather taunting since I was being forced to pay Â£129. The foyer is revolting, the room is like a prison, there were wear holes in the curtains so light streamed in from sun-up (ie 4am), the TV didn't work properly, the bed was wonky, and as I was on the ground floor I had the joys of a full-blooded argument with 5 people involved in it directly outside my room window at 3am. After a very poor night's sleep, I checked out, or rather handed over the room key-card and asked for a receipt. Only to be told they don't do receipts and I should get it from the company who booked it. This from a man who was looking at my account, on a PC with a printer sitting next to it. I asked him how hard and difficult pressing the "PRINT" button was, to which he gave a massive "Harumph..." so I told him to place the receipt somewhere unpleasant when it had printed, and walked out. It then took a very long walk through Battersea and over the Thames onto the Embankment before I even saw a cab to get me to work. In summary, a hovel, miles out of London, very unhelpful staff. Don't stay here unless it truly is your last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean no probs what so ever!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahruddick
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Travelodge in Battersea as a last minute deal. We were attending a weekend festival at Hyde Park and wanted somewhere no too far. Had reservations about this hotel after some of the reviews, but we had no problems at all!!! The hotel was like any other travelodge clean and tidy and a nice room. It had nice bathrrom with shower and flat screen tv nice bed and wardrobe. Pretty much the same as an IBIS and premier inn. Its not too far from Clapham station either which is very handy. Its a 5 min taxi ride for aboutÂ£6 or a nice 15 min walk in the sunshine. The area surrounding is busy but dont let that put you off, i felt very safe here and would defo return.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed in Room 403, and it should be condemned”
Reviews.Author: Anncadogan
Reviews.Content: I booked online, and arrived at the hotel at 11.45pm, to be given the key Room 403. When I entered the room, something caught my eye - a black ceiling in the bathroom! On closer inspection the toilet was fuilthy, the sink had hair in, the bin in the bathroom and the bedroom hadn't been emptied and stank, the carpet hadn't been hoovered, there was no mattress cover on the bed, no tea and coffee making facilities - not a lot going for it. I complained to the Duty Manager, who explained it was the last room in the hotel, nothing else available there, or anywhere else - they'd been overbooked and had a bit of a nightmare. It was that or my car! I did stay, but didn't get too much sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it.”
Reviews.Author: Cath066
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in some places, but this place really was the pits, staff ok when they were there, Â£4.50 for a takeaway breakfast in a bag, cold water in the shower, the reception and front of hotel needs a good clean, Not welcoming in the least.

Reviews.Title: “Expected the worst, was midly impressed BUT stay only if you must”
Reviews.Author: suziemclean
Reviews.Content: Let it be known that my friends and I had stayed in this hotel out of sheer desperation. We needed a place to spend the night in London but because of the match between Manchester United and Barcelona in Wembley Stadium that weekend, every other hotel within our budget was fully-booked. The poor reviews of this hotel did put me off. But having stayed a night here, I must say that it was above my expectation. However, I would have to agree with some of the things pointed out by earlier reviewers. By the way, I shared a first-floor room with a friend whereas her brother and his friend shared a twin room on the third floor. Their room was evidently smaller. Room The good I checked in the day after the football match and was put on the first floor very close to the lift. There was a fire barrier door separating my room from the lift, so there was no noise from it. The double-bed room we got was very spacious and clean â€” surprise, surprise! The bathroom was clean -- it had a tub, whereas the smaller rooms only had a shower. The bathroom floor, sync and tub were clean. I didnâ€™t notice any stains. The bad The shower curtain needs to be replaced as the foot was already yellowing. The water pressure for our toilet was not to my liking. After flushing, it takes more than a minute to fill the tank. Not good when youâ€™re sharing it with other people who may need to go immediately after you. There is no air-conditioning, so for better ventilation, we left the windows open overnight. As the hotel is situated next to the main road and the route of London buses, it is very noisy almost at all times. In addition, some guests were out drinking in front of the hotel -- they were possibly drunk -- and talking really loudly. Light sleepers will definitely find this bothersome. There is no telephone in the room. Environment/location The good The Battersea train station is a 10-minute (or less) leisurely-walk away. Many London buses pass by the hotel. Bad The hotel is located within a residential area â€” lots of flats. No offence to those who live there but the area seems a bit dodgy. I would think twice about walking alone around this area, especially at night as there are not many pedestrians around. But I have seen young women walk alone to the train station. But I would still advice you to walk with a friend. Some guests are neither cultured nor considerate. My friend was awoken by drunk guests drinking and talking loudly just below our window. The next morning, we saw a pair of panties and bra on the sidewalk, clearly thrown out of the window from one of the rooms. I wouldnâ€™t advice walking to the train station with a heavy suitcase as the walk is comfortable only if youâ€™re carrying something light. If you have things with you, best to take the taxi which costs between 6 pounds and 7 pounds. You can get cabs from in front of the station. Service The bad You canâ€™t leave your bags with the hotel as there is no luggage room and the hotel simply refuses to do so. Internet The bad No free wifi. Verdict Iâ€™m not keen to stay here again as the environment feels a little too seedy. Besides, the room does not come with breakfast. There is no free wifi service at all. I think I would be better off staying at better rated B&Bs in London, which offer a better environment for a comfortable stay for just 10 pound more.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Gonzopete
Reviews.Content: Myself and several friends booked rooms in this Travelodge for my Stag-Do stay in London. I researched extensively to strike a balance between room price, parking cost and central London proximity. This location came in best all round. The rooms, if booked early, are plenty cheap enough. The parking is Â£5 per 24 hours, a good rate this close to central London. It is outside the congestion zone. It is within very easy reach of the main attractions via bus, train or taxi. So onto the hotel itself. It is a typical soulless and clinical Travelodge. Devoid of character and charm. But then that's not why we book to stay at these types of establishments is it. It was CHEAP, like the budgie. The reception staff was..........well........there. Not overly helpful or even that pleased to be at work (but then who is) Basic foyer amenities are available. Coffee machine, a couple of vending machines and a very dubious sounding "breakfast in a bag" no doubt whipped up by our less than enthusiastic host in a small room behind reception. The room was fairly clean and tidy. The usual tea & coffee bits and soap are all that is really worth taking, if your that way inclined. Personally I love the little freebies hotels provide so I was left a little disappointed by Travelodge's offerings. But of course this is covered on their website in some babbling jargon about saving the customer money. The room isn't overly big, but this is central London after all. The bed was comfortable enough and our TV worked normally, albeit all the music channels had been muted at the source (presumably to avoid excessive noise) Our mirror was missing though, no doubt ripped off the wall and thrown out of the window by some rock star wannabee during a previous stay! The one thing that did strike me as particularly poor was the apparent lack of security. All the external door had locks fitted to accept room keycards, yet none of them were ever locked, even upon our arrival home at 4AM one morning, it was left a jar for anyone to just stroll in. The car park has secure fencing around it though the barrier gates appear to have been smashed off and destroyed at some point. There's a good chance your room will look over one of the car parks though so you can keep an eye on your vehicle. OVERALL------A good, cheap bolthole for those not intending on staying in their room for long. Has a few shops and restaurants/take-away's just down the road within easy reach. Good transport links.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Mike48
Reviews.Content: Typical Travelodge fare - Basic room, few facilities, bed OK, bathroom acceptable. No cae or attention but reasonable for the money. However for a few pounds more Premier Inn is far superior

Reviews.Title: “teriffic value for money”
Reviews.Author: holidaymakerCoventry
Reviews.Content: hotel very clean large spacious rooms,fantastic location bus stops outside to victoria lovely little pub across the road witherspoons pub 5mins walk away all in all a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Mambaman
Reviews.Content: Rooms are adequate for the price you pay & to get your head down. Use the C3 or 295 bus from Clapham Jcn if not arriving by car. Yes the rooms may not be the best but you would pay more for some nasty old B&B room on the coast with no en suite! I would definitely stay here again for a budget room a short train ride from the City.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: JLG86
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night with two other mates. When first arrived and parked up we had problem with ticket machine. However a member of staff was very helpful came out and sorted it! Room was very basic but spacious but as all we were doing was sleeping there it was fine. And for Â£35 between the 3 of us an absolute bargain. If u want somewhere to go out on a night out and then just crash then it's perfect for the price!

Reviews.Title: “out of the way and run down”
Reviews.Author: SusieRoseCardiff
Reviews.Content: Considering the price that I paid for a hotel close to London town I can't complain too much. Its not in a nice loaction its a residential area of Battersea that I thought was quite rough. The one night the other guests on our floor were noisy and disruptive. There are no phones to call down to the desk to complain. You would have to walk past these people running up and down the corridors tro complain. The guests being disruptive is not the hotels fault but not being able to complain is. The bathroom was quite dirty and the taps were broken. On the plus side our room was enormous. very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly suitable for overnight stays when you're doing a sight seeing tour.”
Reviews.Author: N33M0
Reviews.Content: I don't know if me and my friends were extremely lucky with our room or if the other reviews are quite exaggerated. I went to London with two friends for a weekend and we just needed a place to spend the night without spending too much money. To be honest, I was a little afraid in what kind of condition the room might be because I've read some of the reviews (but after we had booked the room). However, the room was ok. We stayed with 3 people in a family room, which was clean, we had enough and clean sheets for the beds, fresh towels and handsoap. Everything you expect from a travelodge room in this price category. Of course, it wasn't the nicest hotel room I've ever seen as one of the lamps was a bit aslope and we had a view to the main road from our window. But as I just wanted a place to sleep and not a room to sit in all day, it was okay. Perfectly suitable for young people without much money who want to spend a sight seeing weekend in London.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for the shabbiest London Hotel- you've found it.”
Reviews.Author: clearlymagic
Reviews.Content: Carpets, furniture, mattresses, pillows all filthy. Furniture torn. Window stuck open- catch broken.Reported it and they removed the handle and taped over the handle, leaving it open?! Carpark not fully lit and now operated by an external company, so don't expect any security. No warning of this from website and "no change given for parking meter" Carpark door was unlocked all night, so anyone could walk in. Externally the hotel has large areas of facing missing and there is constantly unemptied bins overflowing in the carpark. The carpark was also littered with screws and broken glass. Not easy on the tyres... Really this hotel has fallen way below Travelodge standards elsewhere and they should be ashamed it is branded with their logo. A lot of problem seems to be a maintance man who seemingly maintains nothing at all. People stay because it is cheap for London and relatively central (although a long bus ride from a tube) but it really is a wreck of a place which continues to fall apart.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine thanks”
Reviews.Author: IMYOURVENUS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Travelodge Battersea with a friend (we had seperate rooms though) just before Christmas and we chose it simply because it was a short walk from a gig we were going too.I'd read the reviews beforehand but because it was so convienient for the venue I booked. Was very pleased to find a parking space on arrival, you have to pay but to be honest it was cheaper for overnight than a lot of the car parks where I live ! The outside of the building reminded my friend and I of Wentworth detention centre but the reception area was clean, the first person I talked to at reception about parking didn't smile and was very robotic and the guy we spoke to when we checked in was the same but hey ho.It's typical Travelodge,narrow corridors etc but the room was perfectly adequate and very clean and yes the view out of the window was not very nice but who cares really ? The room was quiet, didn't hear traffic noise or aircraft and it had a TV and clean tea and coffee things.The shower was very good as I'd just driven for nearly 3 hours so was very welcome and enough towels etc. All in all it was absolutely fine for our needs and not a bad price for London. I would stay again if I was working or whatever in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected suprise”
Reviews.Author: iaindaza
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the other reviews having already booked. I was therefore pleasantly suprised by the politeness of the staff and the cleanliness of the hotel. I did stay in the new part so this may have helped. It is on a main bus route and therefor handy for the city centre. I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, Depressing Travelodge (Battersea)”
Reviews.Author: mfra75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this travelodge (I wouldn't call it a hotel!) for 2 nights on the 25/12/2010 and 26/12/2010 with my daughter. We had a double room and was appalled at the decor in the room. The dark blue very worn out carpet and greyish walls were very depressing. In addition, the pillows were paper thin and hard and there was only a thin bedshit on the uncomfortable bed. The bathroom had a foul smell and needed disinfecting and bleaching from top to bottom. In the tea making area, the crockery and cutlery had been left on bare wood and the cups just left there so that flies could lay their eggs in!!!! Needless to say we didn't touch the crockery and cutlery in that room. The reception area was unwelcoming and it needs a touch of paint. This travelodge has no restaurant and no bar facilities. We do not feel that we got value value for money at this Travelodge in Battersea. We paid Â£79 for the room and it was a waste of money. I would't recommend this Travellodge. DON'T GO THERE PLEASE, THE WHOLE PLACE NEEDS A COMPLETE REVAMP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, shabby & terrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: NotRuthWatson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel just before Christmas and was very disappointed for Travelodge standards. The hotel is very tired and grubby, with poorly maintained rooms (one towel for two people, pillows like cardboard). The most dissapointing part of the stay was the appalling front desk staff, who were totally uninterested and unhelpful. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Actually not as bad as I was lead to believe from reviews on here”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, I was expecting a little shop off horrors, suffice to say this hotel is nowhere near the bad standard that is bestowed upon the Travelodge at Gatwick Airport which should be condemmed. The hotel is actually okay, maybe I got a good room, but for Â£19 on a Monday night, i could not complain. Staff were friendly, was allocated a quiet room facing the back away from the street, it was reasonably quiet and the doors did not slam hard as per other travelodges. The family room I was allocated was of a reasonable size, yes it was a little on the dated side and the in room lighting could have been a lot brighter, but it was warm, the shower was warm and the room itself was clean. Its not the best travelodge in the world, but it most certainly is not the worst one i have stayed in and I have stayed in quite a few over the years. Hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from Clapham Junction, buses 44, 295 and 170 stop nearby so accessable for Chelsea or Victoria if required. For Â£19, could not moan really although if you pay a lot more than this yes of course you would be disappointed and the Express by Holiday Inn at Wandsworth down the road is a much better option overall.

Reviews.Title: “Get me outa here!”
Reviews.Author: paul-strummer
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review at 7am from my hotel room. I'm staying here as I am working at a trade show at Olympia this weekend. This hotel is deeply disappointing. You drive in around the back of dodgy, run down council estates. The barrier to the car park is broken AND they have the cheek to expect you to pay to park your car, even though you are staying at the hotel. It's their own car park and at Â£65 a night + Â£75 for a weekend stay I expect FREE parking. The interior of the hotel is grim. One lift was broken and the snack machine was broken. Hotel staff were perfunctory and seemed more interested in watching the tv in reception. When asked to explain why I had to pay for the car park they just shrugged. The room itself was large, but mostly empty. There was a fine view of an industrial car park (Sweeping views of the savannah weren't expected!). It was pouring with rain but I found no hair dryer in the room. I had to request one at reception but was told to be quick because other people might need it!. The TV had permanent interference on all channels. The remote control battery was dead so I had to fiddle around with the buttons at the back of the tv to get it to work. The room was freezing when I arrived so I had to switch heater to maximum to get any warmth. Early this morning, around 2:30 am it sounded like a herd of buffalos rampaging through the corridors. It was group of youths running up and down, laughing and swearing. This continued for about 20 minutes and was followed by frantic banging and thumping on doors with cries of '###ing let me in you b###ds' and similar comments. It quietened down, but then began again at 3am, and finally at 4:30am. I didnt look outside but there was no sign of hotel staff trying to control the situation. I suspect they remained oblivious. There is no phone to call reception in the room to complain. It's quiet now, so I am packing up and getting the hell out. They are currently running a TV ad campaign saying how much they value their customers getting a quiet nights sleep. Well sorry Travelodge, bang goes several million of your advertising budget!!! Unless you relish getting an experience of britain in the depressed 1970's I would avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel777
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this particular hotel because of its proximity to family we were visiting. The location worked for us and the room was clean. Those were the only two positive things I have to say about this hotel. Check-in is at 3:00. We arrived at 2:30 hoping to check-in a bit early. We were told there is a 15 Pound early check-in fee so we sat and waited until 3:00 to check in. I checked their website before leaving for England to see if they provide hair dryers; they do. When we got to our room there was no hair dryer so we asked at the front desk. We were told it's first come, first served. We did not get a hair dryer until our second day. They also do not provide shampoo or conditioner. When we asked about it we were told we could buy some from a vending machine in their so-called lobby. It also took 3 days before we got enough towels for 2 people. They completely neglected to clean our room one day. We were still in our room the next day when housecleaning came around. They never came back so we went 2 days without having our room cleaned. We found most of the front desk help (the men) very unhelpful and unfriendly; the two women we spoke with were better. Our major complaint is that customer service doesn't seem to be a priority.

Reviews.Title: “dont bother”
Reviews.Author: chel_xxx2001
Reviews.Content: me and my family were in london for 1 night to visit family. we arrived, didn't seem to bad on arrival. got to corridoor where are room was and smelt damp. We got into the room and it stank of cigarettes. the Curtains were mouldy. The tv was fuzzy. there was no quilt for the third bed (which also smelt of smoke) as well as ours. we took are own travel cot for the baby luckity as i dred to htink what they would have given us. Very basic. the tea and coffee mugs were dirty, not been washed up from the previous people. was dirty in general. I also got woken up by someone moaning in the night. Probably a good place for students looking for somewhere to go after a night of clubbing and taking someone back for the night. as for a family room, there was nothing family about it. We didnt bother having breakfast there, we couldnt get out quick enough. Very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Read the previous reviews! Hotel is a disgrace.”
Reviews.Author: gordon1517
Reviews.Content: This is a very poorly managed, smelly, shabby, dirty and un kept hotel. Regardless of whether the hotel is the subject of no investment the management here should be disciplined as the basic housekeeping standard is terrible. Dirty bathrooms, dirty furniture, light fittings thick with dirt, tv does not work. Half roll of toilet tissue, not enough towels!!! Travelodge needs to inspect this hotel and coach/support the team until improvements are noticed.

Reviews.Title: “It was an... experience...”
Reviews.Author: ots3go
Reviews.Content: Staying down in London is never a nice ordeal for us Northern folk but adding this place to the mix was a sheer nightmare. Ranging from the shorting light switches to the hot / cold / stop / start showers, the torn up carpets, smashed car park barriers, ancient mattresses. I believe the company paid Â£75pppn for this place... It's not worth a fiver.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but below par, even for Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: sboy2010
Reviews.Content: I booked a family room at this hotel for a leisure trip with 2 friends and we needed a cheap no fuss hotel for 2 nights. Frankly, it's a poor hotel. Everything seems broken or damaged. Even the front door was on the latch 24/7, giving a frightening lack of security. The bathroom was falling apart and hadn't seen TLC for a long time, the sink had a pair of false eyelashes left in it from the previous occupant. A request for 3 towels seemed incomprehensible to the recptionist who'd check 3 people into a family room!!! Reasonably cheap for London, but still not good enough. Try elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, noisy and cold.”
Reviews.Author: charchar11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this travelodge for 1 night. I understand that it is basic, because of the budget price, but I paid Â£80 for 1 night, so not a budget price for me! The room was very basic, only one pillow each, we asked for one more each, the response was unhelpful. Had to ask a few times and explain that we could not sleep with only a little flat pillow each! Was a loud humming noise all night coming from the car park outside, I presume from the air conditioning? Couldn't sleep, can't believe there are rooms with this level of noise! Awful night, highly disappointed, will not stay here or recommend. If you must stay in Battersea, don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Half a loo roll and one hand towel for3 people overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Kateslate
Reviews.Content: O my god what a dump. Literally half a loo roll for3 people when we arrived. There was 1 small towel between us in the room. When I went to reception I was told that was standard in all the rooms but I eventually got 2 large towels after half an hour wait. We got no sleep as the room down the hall were having a rave and nothing was done to stop it. I would never stay in a travelodge again. Ruined my weekend in London, marie 24

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be declared unsanitary”
Reviews.Author: jilly157
Reviews.Content: we stay at theis hotel 3 times a year for the nearby antiques fair at battersea park, the area has few hotel in the afffordable range, but the list of things wrong with this hotel is so long that frankly it should be closed down beds stained showers dont work staff rude lift doesnt work back security car park dorr open all the time towels not replaced things go missing colleagues bitten by bed bugs underwear on window sills mould in the showers ITS REALLY REALLY HORRID there should be an inspection of this place , why travelodge chain allow this i cant even begin to imagine

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all, considering”
Reviews.Author: Yeltzer
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Battersea TL on a few occasions now, both for lads weekends away and as a base for going to see the tennis at Wimbledon. Yes, itâ€™s not the most appealing of Travelodges and it could do with the proverbial â€œlick of paintâ€� but the location and price have always trumped these. Clapham Junction is a ten minute walk away or thereâ€™s a bus stop right outside which serves most of London it would seem. As others have mentioned, the beds arenâ€™t particularly cosy and the bathrooms are very basic, but you get this at ALL Travelodges, not just this one, as you do with the dodgy stains around the place â€“ its why they are so cheap in the first place. After all, its just somewhere secure to sleep for a few hours (although the lack of aircon and windows which donâ€™t open far arenâ€™t ideal in the summer). Never had a problem with the staff and/or receptionist either. If itâ€™s a trade off you want between location and price, then look no further. I wonâ€™t in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,dirty, unkempt hotel”
Reviews.Author: clearlymagic
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a number of times as its location is very handy for where I need to be. The bustop outside the hotel takes you straight into central London and there is parking at the hotel(for a fee). But something is always not working. There are never light bulbs in all the light fittings. The bed clothes are not changed however long you stay. The towels are often stained and dont even think about looking under the beds- other peoples underwear and other peoples toenails lurk there. But probably worst of all, the mattresses are all shot. The edges of the beds have been sat on by so many people that the springs have gone. On one occasion we actually had a spring sticking out of the mattress! The bathrooms tend to have black mould round the shower/bath and one friend even flushed the loo and got other people's sewage spurting out of the loo at him! SO...I won't be back. The staff are friendly enough but the maintenance man is a mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty and difficult to get to”
Reviews.Author: imnotfussy
Reviews.Content: A bit tatty for a Travelodge and few ameneties around, area a bit run down, but Ok as somewhere to sleep, however would absolutely not recomend because it si so remote from any decent public transport, took forever. and coming back late at night ended up taking expensive cab ride from fulham station, a very bad base for either visiting central london or if your staying in town for a night out. Also on a hot night with the windows open the traffic noise was deafening.

Reviews.Title: “If it was very cheap it would be just about ok...”
Reviews.Author: ArbitraryLarry
Reviews.Content: This really is a pretty rubbish hotel - the reception experience is surly and that's being kind. That is if there's actually anyone at the reception. The hotel has zero facilties so don't plan on any convenient eating etc (although the Gazette french restaurant nearby is quite nice). The rooms are basic to say the least - no aircon and windows that only open about an inch. Not particularly comfortable beds and the flattest pillows I've ever seen. Only 1 toilet roll in the bathroom. And somehow the miracle of TV channels and freeview seems to have passed by Travelodge as the TV choice made me think we'd timewarped back to the 1980's. On a positive note, the room and hotel were reasonably clean, the bathroom functional (apart from loo roll) with working shower (no bath but that's fine for us), and the hotel and room were reasonably quiet. In terms of cost I think it's stupidly over-priced even if it had decent faciltiies, and as it is now it's massively over-priced. The only redeeming feature is that you can usually find somewhere to park on the streets nearby at the weekend so you don't need to pay for parking. All in all, I would only ever stay there again if I really need to stay in that area and the other hotels are full - which is the reason I stayed this time - the Premier Inn was full... and I certainly wouldn't recommend it to anyone unless they were in a similar situation...

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: beljaneprice
Reviews.Content: The double room was a good size but really run down. There was mold on the ceiling in the bathroom and no loo roll!! Taps in the bath were scummy looked like they had never been cleaned. The room was boiling hot with no fan or aircon. You could only open the window 2 inches which did not help. Â£95 Bed and breakfast was a total rip off. Will never use travelodge again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: meteor26
Reviews.Content: Despite reading some earlier bad reviews about this patricular hotel I personaly found it to be of excellent value, with friendly capable staff on duty at all times. The rooms are typically Travelodge, basic but adequate for the needs of someone who only needs somewhere to sleep. The room was very clean and well serviced. The only downside was the proximity to traffic which was audible at all times especially as the room window was open continuosly due to the fine weather - not something which the hotel can be held responsible for and they do mention this on the website. Frequent bus services to Victoria are but a short walk from the hotel entrance. I personally would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: andy7070
Reviews.Content: travel lodge you should be ashamed that you have this joke of a hotel in your chain!! from the minute we entered the reception it was awful..the recepionist was miserable,couldnt care less attitude and totally uninterested...when we went into the the hallway of where our room was the carpet stank and mean they totally reeked!!!! and the room was the same,carpet stank..havent had a good wash in years and the whole hotel was tired ..the shower was broke and went hot and cold non stop..toilet didnt flush properly the tv was only 5 channels and even then couldnt get a good signal.......doors banginng all night and with only 1 pillow it was neck destroying... upon leaving my wife made a complaint about the shower and he said "oh yeah it doesnt work properly".....and on that comment i think i will leave it to your own imagination....no way a 3 star!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again - not even cheap!”
Reviews.Author: SpecsX40
Reviews.Content: Just dreadful. Travelled to London to watch the Chelsea v Bolton match with 2 young teenagers and my partner. Booked this hotel as it was the closest I could get without spending a fortune - however, the family room was so cramped with an uncomfortable pull out sofa bed for the boys and only 2 extremely flat pillows on our double bed. We had to ask 3 times for more pillows and eventually was given one to share. Not enough coffee/milk/tea for the 4 of us - how much would that have cost?! No phone in the room either. Such a sparse, boring room - I wish I'd have paid a little extra and stayed elsewhere, still you live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in family room”
Reviews.Author: redguscat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family room with my parents - very good value indeed for Â£29. It's a standard Travelodge room - not sure what some of the other reviewers expect - but clean enough, friendly, helpful staff and a reasonable location with a good bus service to Victoria. Quiet for a Saturday night in London and we all slept well. It's within walking distance (10 - 15 minutes) of Clapham Junction station with good rail links to the rest of London from there. We ate at Ace Fusion on St John's Hill, Clapham - about a 10 minute walk from the hotel and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “adequate”
Reviews.Author: bomaolciarain
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic-but if you just require a bed for the night it is fine. The room was cold and the heater did not work but reception provided another duvet which worked well. Area around hotel is rundown and ugly but price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “it does what is says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: westythebesty
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel on a Monday afternoon during half term. Plan was to visit attractions in the city centre. Very nice helpful man on reception who told us where to get a travel pass from and which buses to catch to the centre. Checked into the room. Very basic, but reasonably clean. Took the 44 bus to Victoria which only took 20 mins and we were able to see the sights on the way. Had a good three days and the Hotel proved a good base. Only really one gripe - there was a shortage of pillows during our stay. Homebase next to the hotel must have done a roaring trade that week!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a bed for the night, that's it”
Reviews.Author: swansea_wales_87
Reviews.Content: If it's only a bed for the night you're after then this hotel is for you, other than that I would advise you'd look more central. Fortunately I was only in the hotel long enough to sleep and wake up, and I suppose that's what most Travelodge's are built for. Cleanliness of the room was okay but the towel was slightly stained and the bed sheet marked, too. Location isn't great at all, so if you're in London for a holiday I would not recommend it - closest train station is Clapham Junction with is a 15-20 minute walk and there are no tourist attractions in the vicinity. And if you were in central London late at night it could be a little bit of a trek back during hours you may not wish to be walking the streets. As I said if it's only a room for the night and if you needed to be in this particular area, it's fine and decent value (Â£55 my room cost), but other than that I'd look elsewhere. No hot food is available at the hotel, but there are vending machines in reception, good for a snack (or a can of Stella) but nothing else. I for one wouldn't stay here again but it's all about the individuals opinion :-)

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: farriermark
Reviews.Content: Apart from the urine stained mattress, prostitutes wandering through the foyer and totally inept manager it was a pleasant stay. The light in the bathroom was not working so the manager kindly offered me the use of another room from which the guests had checked out of earlier though had not yet been cleaned.Miles away from the tube station also. I will do my utmost never to stay in a Travelodge again, thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kentravellers
Reviews.Content: Having booked this Hotel about three months as a cheap overnight stay as we were visiting family in Wandsworth area, we were dreading the visit after reading some of the other comments. However, we were pleasantly surprised - we had a refurbished room which was basic but clean, bed was comfy and there was plenty of hot water - had a good night's sleep so what more can you ask for Â£19.00 a night??!! The car park is fine and for Â£5.00 a day is good value considering your location. Reception staff were helpful - the pillows are ALWAYS flat in Travelodges - we always ask for more and it's not a problem. All in all I would have no hesitation in staying again - you get what you pay for and we were happy with our cheap deal.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant if you don't have spare cash to throw around”
Reviews.Author: JoolsDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent deal from travel lodge website, take advantage of their saver rates but you have to book each night seperately. Stayed here before and will go back again, large family rooms, clean, basic but include towels, kettle, tea bags, coffee etc. Very comfy queen/king size bed, small single sofa bed and extra pull out mattress (one pillow for each person). Cheap parking ajoining the hotel, speak to reception when you get there about how to access discounted option. Public transport into central London is fantastic, Victoria station in about 15 minutes, number 44 bus runs every ten minutes until midnightish and every half hour after that. No restaurant, vending machines in reception for coffee, icecream, bottled water. There is a small shop 2 minutes walk, turn right out of the hotel for necessaties plus great advise on travelcards/oyster.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, warm & comfortable & good value”
Reviews.Author: budemaid
Reviews.Content: Like the previous traveller I am always dubious when you read other people's reviews. We chose this travelodge for its location as my elderly parents and my husband & I needed a base to stay over Christmas whilst visiting our son. His house was a 4 mile drive away and took 10 - 15 minutes on the quiet Christmas roads. Basically, we used the Travelodge as a base for just sleeping. We knew there was no breakfast available but this did not worry us. I am a coeliac too so the 'breakfast bag' would not be any good to me anyway. We took some plastic bowls from home and a few spoons and my son had got us a box of rice krispies and each night we took some milk back to our room from his house so we could have a quick bowl of cereal in the morning before setting out for his house. We came up from Cornwall in the car - very good journey (my Mum & adult daughter (who stayed at her brothers) went on the train to Waterloo to make way for all the presents and food we were bringing up to our sons). We took a little time to find the Travelodge as I hadn't printed a map off but I knew basically where it was but the confusing part was when going along Chelsea embankment we couldn't take a right turn over the bridges but eventually because of a traffic jam we turned around in the middle of the road (as others were doing) and went over Albert bridge. It was then I lost my bearings as it was dark and I couldn't see the map - anyway after a bit of driving around we found ourselves right by the Travelodge and we parked in a side street whilst I went to check in at about 7 pm. We were in rooms 226 and 228 and both have been refurbished recently. You could smell the fresh paint as you walked through the corridors.
